results.title: The Bugs Bunny Road-runner movie
results.creator_credit: Chuck Jones and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A feature length animated film starring everyone’s favourite rabbit, Bugs Bunny. Living in retirement in his carrot-filled mansion in Beverly Hills, Bugs takes us into his portrait gallery where we are introduced to many famous characters such as Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Elmer Fudd, Pepe le Pew, Wile E. Coyote and Road-runner, and also some of the important people behind the animation scene including Mel Blanc and Tex Avery. The film is interspersed with excerpts from some of the most classic Chuck Jones cartoons including Duck Dodgers, Robin Hood Daffy, Duck Amuck, What’s Opera Doc? with Bugs as our host throughout the fun-filled chaotic adventures. The final twenty minutes of the film consists of a compilation of Road-runner cartoons edited down into one long manic cartoon chase, featuring of course, that old die-hard Wile E. Coyote and the ever elusive Road-runner. Character voices by Mel Blanc and Arthur Q. Bryan.

results.title: He died with a felafel in his hand
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, Domenico Procacci, Andrew McPhail and Notorious Films
results.brief_description: Danny (Noah Taylor), onto his 49th share house and in his mid 30s is probably ready for some privacy and independence but is still attracted to the friends and oddball characters that makes sharing a house so attractively horrible. We travel with Danny as he moves through shared houses in Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne. Danny’s life is further complicated by the presence of rental goons despatched by landlords in search of unpaid rent and the police chasing him in relation to a credit card debt thanks to a dodgy housemate. Proving he is not responsible is harder than lying about his identity. Based on the book of the same name by John Birmingham, `He Died With A Felafel In His Hand’ is a wonderful satire on shared housing. Cast also includes Romane Bohringer, Emily Hamilton, Sophie Lee, Alex Menglet and Damien Walshe Howling.

results.title: My Beautiful laundrette [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Sarah Radclyffe, Tim Bevan, Channel Four, SAF Productions and Working Title Films
results.brief_description: Contemporary South London, with its mixture of races, classes and subcultures is the setting for this engaging film written by Hanif Kureishi. Omar is a young Anglo-Asian man on the make who is taken under the wing of his materialistic, and benevolently corrupt, Uncle Nasser. Omar is given a rundown laundromat to manage and he enlists an old school friend, Johnny, who has joined the National Front out of boredom, to help him run the business. Omar and Johnny begin a sexual relationship while around them friends and family try to get by as best they can in the divided society of Thatcherite Britain. One of the most joyous and insightful English films of the eighties. Cast includes Daniel Day Lewis, Saeed Jaffrey and Roshan Seth.

results.title: Last gasp
results.creator_credit: Scott McGinnis, Stanley Isaacs, Castel Films, Warner Vision Films and Kushner-Locke
results.brief_description: A second-rate horror film which unfortunately does not match some of those wonderful “B” graders of the 1950s. The plot centres around the supernatural, the mystical, the spiritual beliefs of the Totec Indian tribe of Mexico who, as legend goes, live forever when their spirit escapes from their body with their last dying breath and possesses the nearest human. Leslie Chase (Robert Patrick), a ruthless and determined property developer working on a construction project in Santa Del Soz, Mexico, is fed up with the local Totec Indians harassing him and after two of his workers are murdered, Chase has the whole tribe of Indians massacred. Unfortunately for Chase, one of the Indians survives to make a surprise attack on him, biting him on the neck. Chase kills him but not before the Indian has time to expel his last gasp. Six years later in Boone County, Pennsylvania, Chase, still the same arrogant avaricious property developer by day, is cursed by the sacrificial spirit of the tribe in his body by night, filling him with the need to kill, and keep killing. His series of murders eventually lead to suspicion and an investigation by a woman, Nora Weeks (Joanna Pacula), whose husband has gone missing. There is a bit of sex, a bit of blood and guts and really not a lot of horror. Filmed entirely on location in Romania. Cast also includes Vyto Ruginis, Mimi Craven, Alexander Enberg, Nan Martin, Shashawnee Hall.

results.title: The Garbage pail kids
results.creator_credit: Rodney Amateau and Topps Chewing Gum Production
results.brief_description: The Garbage pail kids was a novelty item, bubblegum card created in the late 1980s. The characters appearing on each card were designed to appeal to kids and promoted ‘gross-out’ subjects such as snot and farts. Made hastily to capitalise on the promotion’s success, the film is a comic fantasy in which the bubblegum characters of Valerie Vomit, Windy Winston, Foul Phil and Ali Gator come to life. Dodger (MacKenzie Astin) is the young friend of retired magician, antique store owner and man of mystery, Captain Manzini (Anthony Newley). When Dodger is bullied by a bunch of street villains he turns to The Garbage Pail Kids for help after he unwittingly releases them from their garbage pail (jail). Havoc and adventure results with a plethora of gross-out adventures. Although the film was intended for children some of the themes are more suited for teenagers. Film contains adult language, adult situations, mild violence and a “State home for the ugly”.

results.title: Follow that camel
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Peter Rogers Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
England, 1906, and all is not cricket. After being tricked and humiliated at a high society club during a cricket match, Bertram West aka Beau (Jim Dale), now disgraced, leaves with batsman Simpson (Peter Butterworth) to join the Foreign Legion to prove his worth. Hot on Beau’s tail is the regretful Lady Jane Ponsonby (Angela Douglas) who travels to restore his reputation whilst losing her own. The usual Carry On crew are joined by Phil Silvers who reprises the Sergeant Bilko character in his role as Sergeant Knocker. A strong performance but distracting from the usual Carry On style. A few saucy surprises along the way, like Anita Harris who, usually type-cast as the wholesome girl next door, plays the shock role (for it’s time), of the erotic belly dancer. Cast includes: Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims and Bernard Bresslaw.

results.title: Don't lose your head
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Adder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Carry on”.
The year is 1789 and it is the French Revolution. When an aristocrat of England, Sir Rodney Ffing (pronounced Effing and played by the irreverent Sidney James), reaches an impasse with his partying, balls and available broads and upon news of the revolution, sets sail for Paris to run amok with chum Lord Darcy (Jim Dale). In disguise he rescues many of the French aristocracy from the chopping block and quickly becomes ‘most wanted’. His calling card, a picture of a two finger salute, earns him the name ‘The Black Fingernail’. He continues to outwit and embarrass the Citizen Camembert (Kenneth Williams), chief of the Secret Police and assistant Citizen Bidet (Peter Butterworth) with some very funny disguises and affectionate character voices - not commonly seen in James’ acting roles. The wild, irreverent acts roll to a triumphant end that ensures that this Ffing not only saves the day but also gets the girl. Cast includes: Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Dany Robin, Peter Gilmore, Marianne Stone, Michael Ward, Leon Greene and Julian Orchard.

results.title: Carry on camping = Let sleeping bags lie
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers, Rank Organisation Film Productions and Adder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
The hilarity and double entendre’s fly fast and thick in this 19th film in the ‘Carry On’ series. Some well known gags abound, including the silhouetted tent scene that was reprised in the recent Austin Powers film, ‘The Spy Who Shagged Me’. Sid Boggle (Sidney James) and Bernie Lugg’s (Bernard Bresslaw) plans to trick their girlfriends (Joan Sims and Dilys Laye) into going on a camping trip for nudists (or so they believe), become unstuck. As a cast of characters converge on the campsite, like the ladies from Chayste Place, who are anything but - the fun erupts into a bawdy adventure. Cast also includes: Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Kenneth Williams, Terry Scott, Barbara Windsor, Hattie Jacques, Julian Holloway, Peter Butterworth and Betty Marsden.
results.title_for_label: Carry on camping = Let sleeping bags lie
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers, Rank Organisation Film Productions and Adder Productions

Some well known gags abound, including the silhouetted tent scene that was reprised in the recent Austin Powers film, ‘The Spy Who Shagged Me’. Sid Boggle (Sidney James) and Bernie Lugg’s (Bernard Bresslaw) plans to trick their girlfriends (Joan Sims and Dilys Laye) into going on a camping trip for nudists (or so they believe), become unstuck. As a cast of characters converge on the campsite, like the ladies from Chayste Place, who are anything but - the fun erupts into a bawdy adventure. Cast also includes: Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Kenneth Williams, Terry Scott, Barbara Windsor, Hattie Jacques, Julian Holloway, Peter Butterworth and Betty Marsden.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
The hilarity and double entendre’s fly fast and thick in this 19th film in the ‘Carry On’ series. Some well known gags abound, including the silhouetted tent scene that was reprised in the recent Austin Powers film, ‘The Spy Who Shagged Me’. Sid Boggle (Sidney James) and Bernie Lugg’s (Bernard Bresslaw) plans to trick their girlfriends (Joan Sims and Dilys Laye) into going on a camping trip for nudists (or so they believe), become unstuck. results.title: Carry on Henry = Mind my chopper
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Adder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 21 of Series “Carry on”.
The tale starts on the wedding night of King Henry VIII (Sidney James) after the failed attempts of his last wife to produce an heir. His new wife, Marie of Normandy (Joan Sims), with an obsession for garlic seems equally unpromising, and the King’s manhood at stake. Enter the buxom Bettina (Barbara Windsor) who Henry VIII just has to have, and a mix of the usual sidekicks; Lord Chancellor, Sir Thomas Cromwell (Kenneth Williams), his equerry Sir Roger de Loggerley (Charles Hawtrey) and Cardinal Wolsey (Terry Scott). When ‘the virginal’ queen is found to be pregnant the calamitous hunt is on to find and behead the head that dared before the king.

results.title: The War against the Indians
results.creator_credit: Harry Rasky and Canadian Broadcast Company
results.brief_description: War against the Indians traces the history of North American Indians from 40,000 years ago to the present day. Harry Rasky, writer, producer, director and narrator, questions many of the traditional beliefs about Indians from the point of view of Native Americans. Did Christopher Columbus discover the North American Indians? Don’t you have to be lost to be discovered? The North American Indians were already established and living off the land of North America, perhaps it was they who discovered Christopher Columbus and not the other way round. This documentary, put together with paintings, music, photographs and interviews reflects on their history.
